benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{childAccountId}/transferCredit - Move a given child credit to the parent level

covered: Valid Request: Scenarios cover successful transfer (TC01) and additional valid-transfer cases (TC02, TC08, TC13, TC14, TC17).
Non-Existing Resource: Covered (TC04 for child not found).
Concurrency: Covered (TC14) and regression double transfer (TC16).
Validation / Input: Invalid childAccountId format (TC07), missing required header (TC06), malformed payload/header cases (TC11, TC15).
Audit / Logs: Transfer reason and comment are recorded (TC02).
Edge / Error Scenarios: Insufficient credit (TC03), parent not found (TC05), API unavailable (TC09), not found/empty database (TC12).
Backward Compatibility / Regression: API version handling (TC17).
gaps: Caching behavior: No tests validating caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Rate limiting: No tests around rate limiting or throttling of requests.
Pagination: Not directly applicable to a single-transfer endpoint, but no explicit tests for any paginated lists, if present in related flows.
Server error variety: Only 503, with limited exploration of 500/10x variants beyond API-down scenario (TC09).
recommendations: Add tests for caching headers to verify ETag/Cache-Control behavior when applicable to the PUT endpoint.
Add rate limiting/throttling tests to ensure proper handling under high load.

If there are related endpoints that return lists (not strictly this PUT), add pagination tests there; for this PUT, consider explicit validation of any response body structure on errors, including standardized error formats.
Extend error coverage to additional 5xx scenarios (e.g., 500 Internal Server Error) and confirm proper logging/observability in those cases.
Clarify coverage of edge-case payload formats beyond headers (e.g., body validation for required fields not present or malformed) if applicable.
